name: 李鎮宇
objective:
Students taking this course will
- Learn the core concepts and key business models of e-commerce
- Gain knowledge of the payment, marketing, mobile, and other applications relevant to e-commerce
- Apply your learning into actual practice by analyzing cases and writing an e-commerce business plan, revising it through feedback from stakeholders.
schedule:
Week/Topic
1　　Course Overview
2　　Introduction to E-commerce
3　　E-commerce Infrastructure 
4　　E-commerce Business Strategies 
5　　Online Media 
6　　Online Communities 
7　　E-commerce Retail and Services 
8　　B2B E-commerce
9　　Exam Week
10　　Building an E-commerce Presence 
11　　E-commerce Security and Payment Systems 
12　　E-commerce Marketing and Advertising 
13　　Course Project Presentations (1)
14　　Course Project Presentations (2)
15　　Social, Mobile, and Local Marketing
16　　Ethics, Law, and E-commerce 
17　　Course Revision
18　　Exam Week
scorePolicy:
25% - Participation, Homework, Quizzes
30% - Analysis of E-commerce
20% - E-commerce business proposal
25% - Interim and Final report
materials:
"E-Commerce 2021-2022: Business. Technology. Society."
by Kenneth C. Laudon, Carol Guercio Traver
Pearson Education 2022
